intro: Chilita estanzuelensis, commonly known as the Estanzuelensis Chilita, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in rocky soils and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its alpine habitat. Due to its limited distribution and fragile ecosystem, it is considered a vulnerable species.
